docs.snippet: Civil rights groups say their inboxes and call centers are lighting up with reports of abuse, but caution that it’s too soon to say whether the trend will last.

headline.print_headline: Reports of Bias-Based Attacks on Rise After Presidential Vote
headline.main: Reports of Bias-Based Attacks Tick Upward After Election

docs.snippet: A ban on the use of social media for campaign purposes ahead of local elections in Chile in October has been criticized as overly restrictive and prompted a cross-party group of lawmakers to present a motion on Wednesday to have it overturned.

headline.print_headline: Chile's Social Media Electoral Campaign Ban Triggers Concerns
headline.main: Chile's Social Media Electoral Campaign Ban Triggers Concerns

docs.snippet: The Trump team is rolling out prominent endorsements for the secretary of state pick, hoping to ease concerns over his ties to Russia.

headline.print_headline: Trump Lines Up Republicans to Endorse Tillerson for Secretary of State
headline.main: Trump Lines Up Establishment Republicans to Vouch for Rex Tillerson

docs.snippet: Stores in the future will use virtual reality and other technologies to improve the shopping experience.
Jeffrey Wechsler counts on us to join him in Europe.
The American black bear, who became an internet sensation for strolling around neighborhoods on his hind legs, was believed to have been killed during a five-day hunting season.

headline.print_headline: Pedals the Walking Bear Said to Be Killed in Hunt
headline.main: Pedals the Walking Bear Said to Be Killed by a Hunter in New Jersey

docs.snippet: While the tragedy has prompted vows to be safer, there is a sense of agitation among artists, who often do not have the resources to ensure their industrial event spaces are up to code.

headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Artists, With a Nod to Safety Concerns, Vow to Keep Party Spaces
headline.main: After Oakland Fire, Brooklyn Artists Vow to Keep Partying

docs.snippet: The new administration could make it harder to get low-cost contraception. But there’s no need to panic about the short term.

headline.print_headline: No, Access to Free Birth Control Won’t Be Lost, at Least Not for a While
headline.main: No, Birth Control Coverage Won’t Go Away
